content.description:
Start with perfect hands through a low roof and climb into a handcrack splitter, which unfortunately dead-ends.  Fun while it lasts! Rappel from two bolts.

There is a small plaque at the base.
content.protection: #1 and #2 camalots.  Possible to place a .75 from the ledge at the start.
content.location: Between Pabst Blue Ribbon and One-hit.  See Eric Bjornstad's Desert Rock IV for details.

content.description: Climb a left angling hand crack that splits a calcite covered wall. The route would get another star if it wasn't for the calcite dripping into the crack, making for some rough jams. You might want to put on the foil for this one.
content.protection: Hand sized units. (2-3 each of #1 and #2 Camalots) There is a 2 bolt anchor about 45' up.
content.location: The route is a few hundred feet to the right of Chicken Little. About the center of the wall.

content.description: (AKA: Fine Nine Finger Crack) Climb thin fingers up a clean varnished left facing corner. The crack is mostly a #1 metolious size that opens up in just enough places to keep it fun. Jason was talked in to the hike and climb with an optimistic prediction of a 5.9 crack.
content.protection: Camalots (1) #2, #3.5, Metolious cams (1) #0 Purple, (4) #1 Blue. The is a 2 bolt anchor on the left wall about 65' up.
content.location: The route is located 200' to the right of Moab Flu. It starts atop leaning rocks that form a cave against the wall.

content.description:
Top of the trail. Beautiful thin splitter with three distinct cruxes. Tips crack switch, steep grey alien corner, and clipping the chains. SOOOOO FUN.

Nice one herb
content.protection:
Fingers. Blue metolious-.75.

Could place a lot of grey alien on this. Blue alien/.2 at the crack switch.

1x4 at the pod down low is optional

content.description:
Start up an easier crack then undercling out left under the roof. Pull around the roof and follow a crack to a nice ledge.

****** CAUTION ***** This route currently has a one bolt anchor! The drill batteries died after a couple nights camping in the cold and we haven't gone back to fix this up yet. Feel free to add a bolt to the anchor if you're in the neighborhood.
content.protection: (2) .4 - 3 BD cams.

content.description: A large left-facing corner that goes up to a large ledge with a bolted anchor.  Between Chicken-Little and On the Lamb.  Cannot see the anchor from the ground.
content.protection: Hands and Big Hands.  2"-3"

content.description: The route climbs a left facing dihedral and moves from thin hands to big hands working through a slight bulge near the top.
content.protection: Friends through #3.5
content.location: The route is on the left side of the wall just right of the Constrictor

content.description: Start up a crack 40' below and slightly left of the two opposing dihedrals. The beginning crack has one or two bouldery moves, after you pass this crack scramble up to the right, to the base of the left facing corner. The crack starts out wide and then goes to thin hands to double anchors shared with Bachelor crack.
content.protection: double set of cams with an extra #1 camalot.
content.location: The routes Kister Twister and Bachelor Crack are about 700' to the right from the left end of the wall. They are pretty obvious looking opposing corners, that start about 40' up. There is a two bolt shared anchor between the two climbs.

content.description: This is a fun splitter with varied sizes. About 90' up there is a 10' offwidth up the right side of a flake. There is a 2 bolt anchor on top of the flake. The crack continues above the anchors for another 50 or 60', it is a nice splitter the size of a red metolious. Someone go climb it!
content.protection: Double set of cams with an extra #3, #4, #5 metolious. With stretch you can make it down with one 60 meter rope.
content.location: Moab Flu is the splitter located 10' to the right of the right facing corner climb Kiah Crack.

climbs.name: Kiah Crack
climbs.fa: Bill Kaih, Andy Roberts, LAnce Lemkau

content.description: Climbs up a clean, right facing corner. It starts with 20' of perfect hands, then goes to wide hands for another 40' to a bolted anchor on the right. One of the nicest looking cracks on the wall.
content.location: The route is located about 1000' feet to the right of the left side of the wall. Another few hundred feet past the climbs Bachelor Crack and Kister Twister. A nice looking splitter called the Moab Flu is 10' to the right. You can either rappel from a 2 bolt anchor, or move right at the anchor to join the rest of Moab Flu.

content.description: Begin up 20' of soft rock, then continue with good hand jams that gradually become wide. It's a fun climb if you don't mind the wide stuff.
content.protection: Camalots (3) #2, #3, #3.5, #4. There is a two bolt anchor after about 120', so two ropes are needed for the rappel, or maybe a 70 meter rope would get you down..
content.location: The route is located about 50' to the left of Bachelor Crack and Kister Twister.

content.description: This route climbs a prominent left-facing corner with green lichen on the right wall. Traverse into the corner from the left over tiny gear, climb a short offwidth, then continue up the mostly off-fingers corner.
content.protection: (1) black and blue alien for the start, (1 each) #4 and 5 for the OW, (2-3) .4 BD, (5-6) .5, (3-4) .75, (1) 1 - 2. All sizes in BD unless otherwise noted.
content.location: About 100 feet right of Burn One Down.

content.description:
Climb the right-facing corner about 10 feet left of Two Minutes for Roughing It to a shared anchor with that route. Pretty good if you're looking for another 5.9 pitch and are already unpacked for Two Minutes.

Hard to believe we were the first to climb this one since it's pretty mellow and goes to an already established anchor, so let me know if this has been done before and I'll update the info. Then again, it doesn't seem like many people make it out to the Hideout Wall, so who knows.
content.protection: (2) .4 - 3 BD cams will give you plenty of options.
content.location: Hideout Center. 10 feet left of Two Minutes for Roughing It with a shared anchor.

content.description:
This is a beautiful splitter route with good climbing and rock quality.

P1-Climb the perfect hand crack to a short wide section to a ledge at the base of a pillar. Build your own belay

P2-Continue up more good hands to a large ledge with a two bolt anchor.

P3-Follow the splitter through fists and OW to a belay in a chimney below a large roof.(crux)
content.protection: Bring many hand to fist sizes and a couple of 5 camalots for the OW
content.location: This route is the obvious splitter that is located near the center of the wall. It is probably the most compelling route and is hard to miss when looking up at the wall.

content.description: Mostly fist crack. Honestly, I don't really remember much else about this one except that it was pretty good. Usually I take pictures of new routes but I can't find any of some of these. Happy exploring!
content.protection: (1-2) .75 - 3, (3) 4, (1) optional 5. All sizes in BD.

climbs.name: The Constrictor
climbs.fa: David Mealey, Andy Roberts, and Jason Schroeder Oct 99

content.description:
Start in a left facing corner that soon goes from hands to OW, and when possible move right and climb twin cracks on the right wall. When they come together move back and into the chimney. Climb squeeze chimney for 50' with no pro until it constricts and forces you out to a bolt on the right wall. Climb past two more bolts to the anchors.

Pitch two was started but not completed.
content.protection: bring triple #3 and #4 camalots, one #4.5 and #5,and one each of the smaller sizes.
content.location: The route is on the left side of the wall and is the prominent S-shaped chimney that reaches from the bottom to the top.

climbs.name: Bachelor Crack
climbs.fa: R.D. Pascoe, Andy Roberts, Frank Potempa, Scott Powers, Lance Lemkau

content.description: Bachelor crack shares a start with Kister Twister. It starts by getting up a short crack and scramble (40') to get to the base of the clean right facing dihedral. Climb up the corner with mostly hands and some liebacking up another 60' to a ledge and anchors shared with Kister Twister.
content.protection: Double sets of cams with one extra #2 camalot.
content.location: The routes Bachelor Crack and Kister Twister are about 700' to the right of the left end of the wall.

content.description: Sharp splitter crack that goes from fingers to tight hands. There's a 5.11 extension called Burn Another One Down.
content.protection: (1) .3, (1-2) .75, (1) #2 friend, (2-3) 1, (1-2) 2 cams. All sizes in BD unless otherwise noted.

content.description: A left facing corner that goes from hands to tight hands.  Mostly jamming with some foot holds on the face up high to ease the crux.
content.protection: BD .75-3.  Mostly hand pieces.

content.description:
The route climbs a radically zigzagging left tending route. It has a very lightning bolt look to it.

Begin below a small roof 15' left of a left facing dihedral. Climb fingers to hands to fists.
content.protection: fingers to fist sizes
content.location: The route is centrally located on the wall. It is the only perfect lightning bolt splitter on the wall.
